game_instances.refuse_error_prompt: You refused a proposal which is not active. Proposals are only active if they have been logged by the other player via PROPOSAL and have not been deactivated by you via REFUSE. Try again.

game_instances.player1_initial_prompt:
You are participating in a collaborative selection task.

Together with another participant, you must agree on a single set of items to take. Each of you has your own view of how much each item matters to you (importance). You do not know how the other participant values the items. Additionally, you are given the effort each item demands.
You may only agree on a set if the total effort of the selected items does not exceed a shared limit:

LIMIT = 2985

Here are the item weights:

Item weights = {"thermometer": 160, "clothes": 11, "marinas": 290, "basement": 571, "refrigerator": 479, "uniforms": 991, "cottage": 2, "submarines": 376, "reflector": 35, "museum": 551, "gantry": 871, "rotor": 392, "cartridges": 578, "robe": 454, "diagrams": 210}

Here is your personal view on the importance of each item:

Item importance values = {"thermometer": 979, "clothes": 884, "marinas": 971, "basement": 870, "refrigerator": 58, "uniforms": 94, "cottage": 87, "submarines": 370, "reflector": 856, "museum": 174, "gantry": 754, "rotor": 829, "cartridges": 686, "robe": 875, "diagrams": 316}

Objective:

Your goal is to negotiate a shared set of items that benefits you as much as possible (i.e., maximizes total importance to YOU), while staying within the LIMIT. You are not required to make a proposal in every message and can purely negotiate as well. All tactics are open to you!
Interaction Protocol:
You may use the following structured formats anywhere in your message, at any time during the conversation:

PROPOSAL: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Propose keeping exactly those items.
REFUSE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Explicitly reject opponent's proposal.
ARGUMENT: {'...'}
Defend your last proposal or argue against the player's proposal.
AGREE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Accept the opponent's proposal which ends the game.
STRATEGIC REASONING: {'...'}
	Describe your strategic reasoning or anticipation explaining your choice of action. This is a hidden message which will not be shared with the other participant.

Rules:
You may only AGREE on a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
You may only REFUSE a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
Total weight of any PROPOSAL or AGREE set must be ≤ LIMIT.
Do NOT reveal your hidden importance scores.
A tag in a structured format must be followed by colon and whitespace. The argument must be a python set containing 0 or more strings.
So, it must be of the form TAG: {...}
Strictly follow the interaction protocol and DO NOT write anything beyond the given structure.
The game ends when one side gives an AGREE to a PROPOSAL made by the other player.
The content in your response which can be handed to the other player has to be non-empty.
Only proposals which have been logged via the PROPOSAL format structure and which haven't been refused formally are active.
You must include the ARGUMENT format at least once somewhere in all of your messages.
You must include the STRATEGIC REASONING format at the beginning of every one of your messages. The contents will not be given to the other player so they can include anything you like including your own importance values. Here you should reason step by step to come up with you next move.

Objective:

Your goal is to negotiate a shared set of items that benefits you as much as possible (i.e., maximizes total importance to YOU), while staying within the LIMIT. You are not required to make a proposal in every message and can purely negotiate as well. All tactics are open to you!
Interaction Protocol:
You may use the following structured formats anywhere in your message, at any time during the conversation:

PROPOSAL: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Propose keeping exactly those items.
REFUSE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Explicitly reject opponent's proposal.
ARGUMENT: {'...'}
Defend your last proposal or argue against the player's proposal.
AGREE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Accept the opponent's proposal which ends the game.
STRATEGIC REASONING: {'...'}
	Describe your strategic reasoning or anticipation explaining your choice of action. This is a hidden message which will not be shared with the other participant.

Rules:
You may only AGREE on a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
You may only REFUSE a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
Total weight of any PROPOSAL or AGREE set must be ≤ LIMIT.
Do NOT reveal your hidden importance scores.
A tag in a structured format must be followed by colon and whitespace. The argument must be a python set containing 0 or more strings.
So, it must be of the form TAG: {...}
Strictly follow the interaction protocol and DO NOT write anything beyond the given structure.
The game ends when one side gives an AGREE to a PROPOSAL made by the other player.
The content in your response which can be handed to the other player has to be non-empty.
Only proposals which have been logged via the PROPOSAL format structure and which haven't been refused formally are active.
You must include the ARGUMENT format at least once somewhere in all of your messages.
You must include the STRATEGIC REASONING format at the beginning of every one of your messages. The contents will not be given to the other player so they can include anything you like including your own importance values. Here you should reason step by step to come up with you next move.
